name: Catholic Charities Community Services - International Center
address: Multiple locations throughout Manhattan and the Bronx (specific addresses for classes vary and are often at local parishes or agencies)
description: Offers free English (ESOL) classes and citizenship preparation classes to immigrants, refugees, students, and other newcomers
services: Catholic-owned Language instruction in New-York consultation

name: Catholic Charities of Brooklyn and Queens - ESOL Program
address: Various locations including Corpus Christi Roman Catholic Church (Woodside, Queens), St Pius Jamaica, Our Lady of Sorrows in Corona, and St. Brendan's Church (Brooklyn)
description: Provides free literacy programming to adult English Learners to improve their English skills. Also offers social services and legal referral information
services: Catholic-owned Language instruction in New-York consultation

name: St. Michael's Catholic Academy - English-Mandarin Dual-Language Program
description: Offers an English-Mandarin dual-language program for students from Kindergarten through 8th grade
services: Catholic-owned Language instruction in New-York consultation

name: School of the Blessed Sacrament - Spanish Classes
description: Offers weekly Spanish classes for children in PreK-8, introducing basic vocabulary, conversational skills, and Spanish culture
services: Catholic-owned Language instruction in New-York consultation

name: Our Lady of the Blessed Sacrament Catholic Academy - Foreign Language Program
description: Offers Spanish language and culture enrichment programs for students in grades K-8
services: Catholic-owned Language instruction in New-York consultation

name: John F. Kennedy Catholic Preparatory School - World Languages Department
description: Offers a 4-year language program in Italian, Spanish, and Latin for high school students
services: Catholic-owned Language instruction in New-York consultation

name: Bay Ridge Catholic - Foreign Language Instruction
description: Offers foreign language instruction as part of its curriculum for students
services: Catholic-owned Language instruction in New-York consultation

name: Catholic Schools in the Archdiocese of New York
address: 488 Madison Avenue, 3rd Floor, New York, NY 10022
description: This archdiocese oversees numerous Catholic schools that may offer language programs as part of their curriculum. Specific language offerings and contact information would vary by individual school
services: Catholic-owned Language instruction in New-York consultation

name: Fordham University - Language Programs
address: Multiple campuses including Rose Hill (Bronx) and Lincoln Center (Manhattan)
description: As a Jesuit university, Fordham offers a variety of language programs and courses within its academic departments
services: Catholic-owned Language instruction in New-York consultation

name: Jesuit Volunteer Corps (JVC) - Language Opportunities
address: Various locations in New York, including Harlem and the Bronx
description: While not a direct language instruction business, JVC often places volunteers in roles that involve language use or support, particularly in communities with diverse linguistic needs. Some volunteers may also engage in language learning as part of their service
services: Catholic-owned Language instruction in New-York consultation
